titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elizabeth Martin Green-Wood Cemetery papers 1978.049
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-28 15:40:23 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The collection contains a deed to a Green-Wood Cemetery lot, a letter regarding ownership, a proprietor's ticket, and receipts for the opening of the grave and care of the gravesite of Elizabeth Martin.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Elizabeth Martin Green-Wood Cemetery papers, 1978.049, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a deed to a Green-Wood Cemetery lot, a letter regarding ownership, a proprietor's ticket, and receipts for the opening of the grave and care of the gravesite of Elizabeth Martin.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
